name: CheckBackupRestoreStatus
description:
Check the status of a backup restoration process.

Use this tool to manually check the status of a specific backup restoration on a given backend, using the backup ID. Ideal when automatic polling is disabled.

parameters.name: backend_storage_system
parameters.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides, such as 'filesystem', 'gcs', 's3', or 'azure'.

value_schema.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., `filesystem`, `gcs`, `s3`, `azure`).

parameters.name: backup_id
parameters.description: The URL-safe unique identifier of the backup being restored. Use lowercase, numbers, underscores, and minus characters only.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the backup being restored. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).

parameters.name: backup_bucket_name
parameters.description: Specifies the bucket, container, or volume name if required by the backend.

value_schema.description: Optional: Specifies the bucket, container, or volume name if required by the backend.

parameters.name: bucket_path
parameters.description: Specifies the path within the bucket, optional based on backend requirements.

value_schema.description: Optional: Specifies the path within the bucket.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the weaviate API.

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: Optional: Specifies the bucket, container, or volume name if required by the backend.

value_schema.description: Optional: Specifies the bucket, container, or volume name if required by the backend.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Optional: Specifies the path within the bucket.

value_schema.description: Optional: Specifies the path within the bucket.

parameters.name: backend
parameters.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., `filesystem`, `gcs`, `s3`, `azure`).

value_schema.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., `filesystem`, `gcs`, `s3`, `azure`).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the backup being restored. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the backup being restored. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).
